sec.title: Terms and definitions
sec.p: For the purposes of this document, the following terms and definitions apply.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: resultant of upward forces, exerted by the water on a submerged or floating body, equal to the weight of the water displaced by this body
reference level for soundings in navigation charts
numerical reference that indicates whether the flow will be laminar or turbulent for a given set of conditions
référence numérique indiquant si un écoulement est soit laminaire soit turbulent pour un ensemble de conditions données
numerische Bezugsgröße, die anzeigt, ob die Strömung unter definierten Bedingungen laminar oder turbulent ist
language used in a domain (3.1.2) and characterized by the use of specific linguistic means of expression
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The specific linguistic means of expression always include domain- or subject-specific terms and other kinds of designations as well as phraseology and also may cover stylistic or syntactic features.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: substance capable of holding materials together by adhesion
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The term “glue” was used originally for an adhesive prepared from a hard gelatin. Through general use, the term became synonymous with the term “adhesive” in referring to adhesives prepared from synthetic resins. The term “adhesive” is now the preferred general term.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: means of stopping or slowing the wheelchair
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The running brake may include one or more of the following types of brake: dynamic brake, regenerative brake and friction brake (either fail-safe or manually applied).

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: Boolean operation (02.05.01) whose result has the Boolean value 0 if and only if each operand (02.10.02) has the Boolean value 0
opération booléenne (02.05.01) dont Ie résultat a Ia valeur booléenne 0 si et seulement si tous les opérandes (02.10.02) ont la valeur booléenne 0
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: «OU inclusif» a le sens de la conjonction latine «vel».

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: primary single component or portion of a dental implant which is intended to remain within tissues
partie ou composant individuel primaire d'un implant dentaire conçu pour rester dans les tissus
deck structure supported by vertical and possibly inclined piles extending into the sea, frequently in a direction normal to the coastline
diaphragm, usually of fixed size
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: This term is often used loosely.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: diaphragme, généralement de format fixe
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Ce terme est souvent employé dans le sens large.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: диафрагмa, обычно нерегули¬руемaя
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Этoт термин в русскoм языкe сливается с термином «диафрагма» и отдельно не существует.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: group of related subjects of standardization (1.2)
groupe de sujets de normalisation (1.2) reliés entre eux
совокупность взаимосвязанных объектов стандартизации (1.2)
any event or series of events that disrupt ecosystem, community, or population structure and alters the physical environment
tbx:langSet.tbx:source: U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY. Terms of Environment: Glossary, Abbreviations and Acronyms online, viewed 2010-07-29].

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: hypothesis to be tested by means of a statistical test
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Modified — The examples and notes given in ISO 3534-1:2006 for this entry have been omitted.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: length of the path travelled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second
tbx:langSet.tbx:source: BIPM, Definition of the metre [online]. Resolution 1 of the 17th meeting of the CGPM (1983) [viewed 2010-07-29].

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: longueur du trajet parcouru dans le vide par la lumière pendant une durée de 1/299 792 458 de seconde
tbx:langSet.tbx:source: BIPM, Définition du mètre [en ligne]. Résolution 1 de la 17e réunion de la CGPM (1983) [consulté le 2010-07-29].

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: rapid, self-sustaining, sub-sonic propagation of combustion (4.46) in a gaseous medium, usually with emission of light
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The term “flame” also represents the concept defined in 4.134.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: to produce flame (4.133)
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The term “flame” also represents the concept defined in 4.133.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: process of combustion (4.46) characterized by the emission of heat and fire effluent (4.105) and usually accompanied by smoke (4.293), flame (4.133), glowing (4.168) or a combination thereof
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: In the English language the term “fire” is used to designate three concepts, two of which relate to specific types of self-supporting combustion with different meanings, and two of them are designated using two different terms in both French and German.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: self-supporting combustion (4.46) that has been deliberately arranged to provide useful effects and is limited in its extent in time and space
self-supporting combustion (4.46) that has not been deliberately arranged to provide useful effects and is not limited in its extent in time and space . [η]=limc→0 (η −η0η0 c)

tbx:langSet.tbx:note: For clarity, the term “beam waist radius” is always used in combination with the symbol and its appropriate subscripts: w 0,u or w σ 0.
tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: radius wu of the beam at the location of the beam waist
rayon wu du faisceau au niveau du col (de la taille)
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Pour clarifier la définition, le terme «rayon du col du faisceau» est toujours utilisé en combinaison avec le symbole et son indice approprié: w 0,u ou w σ 0.

tbx:langSet.tbx:subjectField: second moment of power (energy) density distribution function
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: For clarity, the term “beam waist radius” is always used in combination with the symbol and its appropriate subscripts: w 0,u or w σ 0.
tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: radius wu of the beam at the location of the beam waist

tbx:langSet.tbx:subjectField: moment de second ordre de la fonction de distribution de la densité de puissance (d'énergie)>
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Pour clarifier la définition, le terme «rayon du col du faisceau» est toujours utilisé en combinaison avec le symbole et son indice approprié: w 0,u or w σ 0.
tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: rayon wu du faisceau au niveau du col (de la taille)
condition where the valve drifts from the set position
condition where the valve continues to change position subsequent to the completion of a positional movement

consumed flow rate for —
pilot flow rate,—
internal leakage flow rate,—
output flow rate

débit de fluide dépensé comprenant —
le débit de pilotage,—
le débit des fuites internes,—
le débit de sortie

verbrauchter Volumenstrom, bestehend aus —
Steuervolumenstrom,—
innerer Leckvolumenstrom,—
Ausgangsvolumenstrom
centrally held collection of data that is accessible to users
surroundings in which an organization (3.4) operates, in¬cluding air, water, land, natural resources, flora, fauna, humans, and their interrelation
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Surroundings in this context extend from within an organization to the global system.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: milieu dans lequel un organisme (3.4) fonctionne, incluant l'air, l'eau, le sol, les ressources naturelles, la flore, la faune, les êtres humains et leurs interrelations
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Dans ce contexte, le milieu s'étend de l'intérieur de l'organisme au système global.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: окружение, в котором функционирует организация (3.4), включая воздух, воду, землю, природные ресурсы, флору, фауну, людей и их взаимодействие
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Примечание 1 к терминологической записи: В данном контексте понятие “окружение” распространяется на среду в пределах организации и до глобальной системы.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: standard that is concerned with terms (3.4.1.2) accompanied by their definitions (3.4.2.1), and sometimes by explanatory notes, illustrations, examples, etc.
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Modified — By omitting “usually” in front of “accompanied by their definitions”, this terminological entry is made consistent with the other terms and definitions in this part of ISO 10241.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: expectation of the mean time to dangerous failure

tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Le terme abrégé «MTTFd» est dérivé de l'anglais mean time to dangerous failure.
tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: espérance de la durée moyenne de fonctionnement avant une défaillance dangereuse
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Modifié — Dans le terme, «temps moyen» est devenu “durée moyenne”. La définition était «valeur probable de la durée moyenne avant défaillance dangereuse».]

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: data bank (ISO 1087-2:2000, 6.7) containing terminological data (3.8.1)
language where a word form may consist of more than one morph but the boundaries between morphs are always clear-cut
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Modified — In this part of ISO 10241, “word form” has been used instead of “word” and “morph” has been used instead of “morpheme”. The example has been added.
This note is just showing how you must use an XML entity to represent the ampersand sign: &
tbx:langSet.tbx:example: Korean, Japanese, Hungarian and Turkish are agglutinating languages.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: pressure using absolute vacuum as a reference
pression utilisant le vide absolu comme référence
Druck bezogen auf das absolute Vakuum
valve centre position in which the inlet supply is not connected to an outlet, but outlets are connected to exhaust
position centrale d’un distributeur dans laquelle l’alimentation à l’entrée n’est pas reliée à une sortie, mais où les sorties communiquent avec l’échappement
mittlere Stellung des Ventils, in der der Versorgungs-anschluss gesperrt ist und die Arbeitsanschlüsse mit den Entlüftungsanschlüssen verbunden sind
hydraulic tool with percussive mechanism for light demolition work, primarily for use in the horizontal plane
machine portative hydraulique avec mécanisme de percussion utilisée pour des travaux légers de démolition, principalement pour l'utilisation sur un plan horizontal
crane with the bridge girders supported on the rail tracks by legs
appareil de levage à charge suspendue dont les éléments porteurs s'appuient sur une voie de roulement par l'intermédiaire de palées d'appui
кран, несущие элементы конструкции которого опираются на подкрановый путь при помощи опорных стоек
glowing produced without combustion or other chemical reaction
tbx:langSet.tbx:example: Glowing produced by electrical heating of a tungsten filament.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: error of indication within which the range of radii of a test sphere (8.4) can be determined by a CMM (2.1), the measurements being taken by scanning (2.9) using one stylus (4.1)
tbx:langSet.tbx:note:
There are four scanning probing errors based on different combinations of high point density (7.8) or low point density (7.9) and predefined path scanning (7.5) or non-predefined path scanning (7.6). These combinations are designated as follows:
Point densityPredefined path(j = p)Non-predefined path(j = N)
High (i = H)THPTHN
Low (i = L)TLPTLN

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: erreur d’indication à l’intérieur de laquelle l’étendue des rayons d’une sphère d’essai (8.4) peut être déterminée par une MMT (2.1), les mesurages étant effectués par scanning (2.9) avec un seul stylet (4.1)
tbx:langSet.tbx:note:
Il y a quatre erreurs de palpage en mode scanning selon les différentes combinaisons de haute densité de points (7.8) ou basse densité de points (7.9) et de trajectoire de scanning prédéfinie (7.5) ou trajectoire de scanning non prédéfinie (7.6). Ces combinaisons sont désignées comme suit:
Densité de pointsTrajectoire prédéfinie(j = p)Trajectoire non prédéfinie(j = N)
Haute (i = H)THPTHN
Basse (i = L)TLPTLN

tbx:tig.tbx:term: erreur de palpage en mode scanning

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: means of connecting two or more components
tbx:langSet.tbx:example: Plain pipe to a fitting, or plain pipe to plain pipe.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: scale with a continuum of possible values
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: A continuous scale can be transformed into a discrete scale, by grouping “values”. This inevitably leads to some loss of information. Often the resulting discrete scale will be ordinal.
Scale resolution can be adversely affected by measurement system limitations. Such measurement limitations can, sometimes, give rise to measurements being represented on a discrete, ordinal scale.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: échelle présentant une série de valeurs possibles
tbx:langSet.tbx:example: Échelle d'intervalle et échelle de rapport.
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Une échelle continue peut être transformée en échelle discrète en groupant les «valeurs». Cela entraîne des pertes d'informations inévitables. Souvent, l'échelle discrète en résultant sera ordinale.

La résolution d'échelle peut être affectée par les limites du système de mesure. De telles limitations de mesures peuvent parfois donner lieu à des mesures représentées par une échelle discrète, ordinale.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: part capable of conducting electric current
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Although not necessarily electrically energized in normal operating conditions, it may become electrically energized under fault conditions of the basic insulation (4).

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: pièce à même de conduire le courant électrique
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Bien que non nécessairement sous tension dans les conditions normales de service, elle peut devenir sous tension en cas de défaillance de l'isolation de base (4).

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: grain of Avena sativa L.
grain of Avena sativa L.
another definition
vector used to translate an indicated measured point (2.12) to a corrected measured point (2.13)
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The tip correction vector normally includes the physical size of the tip (e.g. radius) and a correction for the systematic errors of the probing system (2.6). The translation from an indicated measured point (2.12) ot a corrected measured point (2.13) is expressed by the equation: where is the vector of the corrected measured point; is the vector of the indicated measured point; is the tip correction vector.

The conventional practice is normally to use an approximate stylus tip (4.2) radius to establish the magnitude of this vector and an estimated surface normal to establish the direction. The tip diameter can include correction effects such as stylus staft bending and is usually referred to as "effective tip diameter".

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: vecteur utilisé pour la translation d'un point de mesure indiqué (2.12) vers un point de mesure corrigé (2.13)
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: Le vecteur de correction de touche inclut normalement la taille de la touche (par exemple le rayon) et une correction de l'erreur systématique du système de palpage (2.6). La translation d'unf point de mesure indiqué (2.12) vers un point de mesure corrigé (2.13) est exprimé par l'équation: où est le vecteur du point de mesure corrigé; est le vecteur du point de mesure indiqué; est le vecteur de correction de touche.

La pratique conventionnelle utilise couramment un rayon approché de touche du stylet (4.2) pour établir l’amplitude de ce vecteur et une normale à la surface estimée pour établir la direction. Le diamètre de la touche peut inclure des éléments de correction tels que la flexion de l’arbre du stylet, et il est couramment appelé «diamètre effectif de touche».

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: non-fulfilment of a requirement
tbx:langSet.tbx:note:
Nonconformity will generally be classified by its degree of seriousness, such as: —
Class A. Nonconformity of a type considered to be of the highest concern for the product or service. Such types of nonconformity will typically be assigned very small AQL values.—
Class B. Nonconformity of a type considered to have the next lower degree of concern; this is typically assigned a larger AQL value than that in Class A and smaller than that in Class C if a third class exists, and so on. The number of classes and the assignment into a class should be appropriate to the quality requirements of the specific situation.

non-normative-note.label: NOTE
non-normative-note.p:
Nonconformity will generally be classified by its degree of seriousness, such as: —
Class A. Nonconformity of a type considered to be of the highest concern for the product or service. Such types of nonconformity will typically be assigned very small AQL values.—
Class B. Nonconformity of a type considered to have the next lower degree of concern; this is typically assigned a larger AQL value than that in Class A and smaller than that in Class C if a third class exists, and so on. The number of classes and the assignment into a class should be appropriate to the quality requirements of the specific situation.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: care provided in an institution

caption.p: Numbers of patients receiving institutional care ...

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition:
any instrument, apparatus, implement, machine, appliance, implant, software, material, or other similar or related article a)
intended by the manufacturer to be used, alone or in combination, for human beings for one or more of the specific purpose(s) of 1)
diagnosis, prevention, monitoring, treatment or alleviation of disease,2)
diagnosis, monitoring, treatment, alleviation of, or compensation for, an injury,3)
investigation, replacement, modification, or support of the anatomy or of a physiological process,4)
supporting or sustaining life,5)
control of conception,6)
disinfection of medical devices, andb)
which does not achieve its primary intended action in or on the human body by pharmacological, immunological or metabolic means, but which may be assisted in its intended function by such means
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The term “medical device” is usually defined by national regulations. For the purposes of this International Standard, this definition does not list “in vitro diagnostic medical devices” (see ISO 13485:2003, definition 3.7[1]).

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: demonstrated ability to apply knowledge and skills
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The concept of competence is defined in a generic sense in this International Standard. The word usage can be more specific in other ISO documents.

tbx:langSet.tbx:definition: person with the demonstrated personal attributes and competence (3.1.6 and 3.9.14) to conduct an audit (3.9.1)
tbx:langSet.tbx:note: The relevant personal attributes for an auditor are described in ISO 19011.

ref.std: ISO 9999, Sample entry referenced in note
